title: Console output resets when preview is toggled

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Issues that need priority attention. Platform, Curriculum tests (if broken completely), etc.

labels.name: platform: client
labels.description: UI side of the client application that needs familiarity with React, Gatsby etc.

labels.name: status: waiting triage
labels.description: This issue needs help from moderators and users to reproduce and confirm its validity and fix.

body:
### Describe the Issue

In the multi-file editor, if the preview pane is toggled off and then on again, any output in the console will be cleared. Granted, the user can always check their code again to get the console output back. But I'm assuming this is not intended behavior?


### Affected Page

Any page using the multi-file editor

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open the Survey Form in the new RWD
2. Click the Console button so it is showing below the preview.
3. Run the tests.
4. Click the Preview button to hide the preview.
5. Click the Preview button again to show the preview.
6. Notice that the console output resets.

### Expected behavior

Console output should not reset if the preview pane is toggled off/on.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### System

N/A

### Additional context

_No response_

title: Basic JS, Word Blanks needs code blocks

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Issues that need priority attention. Platform, Curriculum tests (if broken completely), etc.

labels.name: scope: curriculum
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

labels.name: status: waiting triage
labels.description: This issue needs help from moderators and users to reproduce and confirm its validity and fix.

body:
### Describe the Issue

The following sentence in the Word Blanks lesson should have a code block (three backticks) surrounding the code section which is directly referring to the completed code block below it on the page.
Instead of:
Consider this sentence - It was really ____, and we ____ ourselves ____.
It should say:
Consider this sentence - 
```
It was really ____, and we ____ ourselves ____.
```

The sentence has been translated because of the missing code blocks (and will not make sense as it's a direct reference to the actual code shown below it)


### Affected Page

https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/javascript-algorithms-and-data-structures/basic-javascript/word-blanks

### Your code

```

```


### Expected behavior

The sentence with the blanks should be in a code block that does not wrap. (three backticks above and below it)
Instead of:
Consider this sentence - It was really **\_\_\_\_**, and we **\_\_\_\_** ourselves **\_\_\_\_**.
It becomes:
Consider this sentence - 
```js
It was really **\_\_\_\_**, and we **\_\_\_\_** ourselves **\_\_\_\_**.
```

### Screenshots

_No response_

### System

n/a

### Additional context

_No response_

title: Prevent preformatted text from wrapping in JS course “constructing strings with variables”

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Issues that need priority attention. Platform, Curriculum tests (if broken completely), etc.

labels.name: status: discussing
labels.description: Under discussion threads. Closed as stale after 60 days of inactivity.

labels.name: scope: curriculum
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

body:
### Describe the Issue

The use of preformatted text within regular text causes a problem for Arabic language comprehension when the preformatted text is allowed to wrap. The user cannot always see whether there is a space character at the point the line wraps so it is better to place preformatted text that is longer than one word in a code block to prevent wrapping.
In the indicated step, we see this issue in two spots.

Here: 

`ourStr` would have a value of the string `Hello, our name is freeCodeCamp, how are you?`.

And:

Set `myName` to a string equal to your name and build `myStr` with `myName` between the strings `My name is ` and ` and I am well!`

For both, we see multi-word backs-ticked phrases. And for both of these we would need them to be in a code block and not added inline to the sentences.

for eg the second one should become:

Set `myName` to a string equal to your name and build `myStr` with `myName` between the strings 
```text
My name is 
```
and 
```text
and I am well!
```

This would prevent the strings from wrapping and obscuring the spacing. As an illustration of the issue, please  review the screenshot provided of the Arabic JS course page and notice how the first wrapped sting that begins with “Hello,..” appears. The substring “are you” is wrapped down to the next line and the space that is normally observed when the line doesn’t wrap, is not visible.

### Affected Page

https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/javascript-algorithms-and-data-structures/basic-javascript/constructing-strings-with-variables

### Your code

```

```


### Expected behavior

We need a way to prevent formatted text from wrapping or a way for the spacing to be visible if it is allowed to wrap.

### Screenshots

![6B39C176-2AAB-45BD-82B0-D3CB67AD6EBC](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35541470/218308378-ff13330a-e5d1-4cc1-8e43-06816e0a1235.png)


### System

N/A

### Additional context

_No response_

title: td width in Balance Sheet course displays incorrectly in Safari

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Issues that need priority attention. Platform, Curriculum tests (if broken completely), etc.

labels.name: scope: curriculum
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

labels.name: status: waiting triage
labels.description: This issue needs help from moderators and users to reproduce and confirm its validity and fix.

body: ### Describe the Issue In Step 52 of the Balance sheet course, the width of the td element is set with the code you can see below. This results in the page layout displayed correctly in Chrome, but it's completely misaligned in Safari (see screenshot attached). I believe that Safari ignores the max-width property. This _might_ actually be correct if I understand MDN correctly: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-width "Applies to: all elements but non-replaced inline elements, table rows, and row groups" ### Affected Page https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/2022/responsive-web-design/learn-more-about-css-pseudo-selectors-by-building-a-balance-sheet/step-52 ### Your code ``` tbody td { width: 100vw; min-width: 4rem; max-width: 4rem; } ``` ### Expected behavior It should display correctly in Safari. Solution might include setting the width of the td elements directly (`width: 4rem`). ### Screenshots ### System - Device: MacBook Pro 14 - OS: macOS Ventura 13.2 - Browser: Safari - Version: 16.3 ### Additional context _No response_

title: Build a Magazine Step 27: Is box-sizing needed?

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Issues that need priority attention. Platform, Curriculum tests (if broken completely), etc.

labels.name: scope: curriculum
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

labels.name: status: waiting triage
labels.description: This issue needs help from moderators and users to reproduce and confirm its validity and fix.

body:
### Describe the Issue

Someone in the forums pointed out that adding the `box-sizing` property just to `html` will not have the intended effect since the property is not inherited. It appears to me that removing this property completely from `html` in the final product does not seem to make any difference to the layout.

- Do we need `box-sizing`?
- If so, if the intent is to apply it to all elements then it should probably be moved to the `*, ::before, ::after` rule set.

### Affected Page

https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/2022/responsive-web-design/learn-css-grid-by-building-a-magazine/step-27

### Your code

```
html {
  font-size: 62.5%;
  box-sizing: border-box;
}
```


### Expected behavior

Either remove `box-sizing` completely or move it into the `*, ::before, ::after` ruleset.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### System

N/A

### Additional context

_No response_

title: updates needed to 'getMessage element' phrase in json apis and ajax course

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Issues that need priority attention. Platform, Curriculum tests (if broken completely), etc.

labels.name: scope: curriculum
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

body:
### Describe the Issue

curriculum/course/step: 04-data-visualization/json-apis-and-ajax/handle-click-events-with-javascript-using-the-onclick-property.md

This file contains the following test message:
Your code should use the document.getElementById method to select the getMessage element.

However, the reference to "getMessage element" in the test message should instead refer to #getMessage element as getMessage is the value of an id attribute.

While we're here also, I noticed that this sentence in the same challenge can be made simpler:
You can implement an onclick event handler which triggers when the user clicks on the element with id getMessage, by adding the following code:

Instead of 'the element with id getMessage' we can just say 'the #getMessage element'? 2 words less but it also makes translating it a lot less wordier for Arabic at least.

### Affected Page

https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/data-visualization/json-apis-and-ajax/handle-click-events-with-javascript-using-the-onclick-property

### Your code

```

```


### Expected behavior

use #getMessage element as described above

### Screenshots

_No response_

### System

N/A

### Additional context

_No response_

title: d3 step uses the phrase 'SVG canvas' half way through the course without any explanation

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Issues that need priority attention. Platform, Curriculum tests (if broken completely), etc.

labels.name: scope: curriculum
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

labels.name: status: waiting triage
labels.description: This issue needs help from moderators and users to reproduce and confirm its validity and fix.

body:
### Describe the Issue

About halfway through the D3 (data visualization with D3) course, we see the phrase "SVG canvas" for the first time on this page: https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/data-visualization/data-visualization-with-d3/add-labels-to-d3-elements

However prior to this point the course only used the phrase 'SVG area' in reference to the space that the SVG takes up on the screen. No explanation was given in the step for what 'SVG canvas' is which was confusing to me as a translator (why a different word than before?) and as a Java developer who sees 'canvas' as a class for drawing. I did a quick google search for 'svg canvas' and all I got were results suggesting that these are different things.

I propose therefore that all occurrences of 'SVG canvas' be replaced with 'SVG area' in this step and following steps (it is mentioned again later several times). 

### Affected Page

https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/data-visualization/data-visualization-with-d3/add-labels-to-d3-elements

### Your code

```

```


### Expected behavior

replace all occurrences of 'SVG canvas' with 'SVG area' in the D3 curriculum

### Screenshots

_No response_

### System

N/A

### Additional context

_No response_

title: Learn HTML Forms Registration Form - Step 17

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Issues that need priority attention. Platform, Curriculum tests (if broken completely), etc.

labels.name: scope: curriculum
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

labels.name: status: waiting triage
labels.description: This issue needs help from moderators and users to reproduce and confirm its validity and fix.

body:
### Describe the Issue

Instructions ask for nested \<input\> elements within each \<label\>, but do not allow multi-line responses. When the response is submitted with multiple nested line, I get the error:

Test
Sorry, your code does not pass. You're getting there.

Hint
You should add the first input after the label text Enter Your Last Name:, and include a space after the colon.

### Affected Page

https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/2022/responsive-web-design/learn-html-forms-by-building-a-registration-form/step-17

### Your code

Fails:
```
      <fieldset>
        <label>Enter Your First Name: 
          <input />
        </label>
        <label>Enter Your Last Name: 
          <input />
        </label>
        <label>Enter Your Email: 
          <input />
        </label>
        <label>Create a New Password: 
          <input />
        </label>
      </fieldset>
```

Passes:
```
      <fieldset>
        <label>Enter Your First Name: <input /></label>
        <label>Enter Your Last Name: <input /></label>
        <label>Enter Your Email: <input /></label>
        <label>Create a New Password: <input /></label>
      </fieldset>
```

### Expected behavior

Submitting code should allow for the case of multi-line nesting. (The first segment of failing code above should pass.)

### Screenshots

_No response_

### System

- Device: MacBook Pro
- OS: OS X 10.15
- Browser: Brave
- Version: 1.47.171 Chromium: 109.0.5414.87 (Official Build) (x86_64)


### Additional context

_No response_

title: missing code elements in challenge 15 of the odin project

labels.name: scope: curriculum
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

body:
in the odin project, there is a sentence that is worded like 

> You should always have the `meta` tag for the charset encoding of the webpage in the head element: `<meta charset="utf-8">`.

it should be worded like 

> You should always have the `meta` tag for the `charset` encoding of the webpage in the `head` element: `<meta charset="utf-8">`.

Here is the file https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/569fc3196b2d3a9a96706f14b13bda48388d2c9a/curriculum/challenges/english/10-coding-interview-prep/the-odin-project/html-boilerplate-question-c.md#the-charset-meta-element

----

If you would like to fix this issue, please make sure you read [our guidelines for contributing](https://contribute.freecodecamp.org/#/), we prioritize contributors following the instructions in our guides. Join us in [our chat room](https://discord.gg/PRyKn3Vbay) or [the forum](https://forum.freecodecamp.org/c/contributors/3) if you need help contributing, our moderators will guide you through this.

There is one Alert that has `Close button` in it, in the codebase, so I am happy to close this and leave a note for it.

https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/2d41346d7956006a732580166771c8490c09c183/client/src/components/Flash/index.tsx

```ts
    <Alert
          bsStyle={type}
          className='flash-message'
          closeLabel={t('buttons.close')}
          onDismiss={handleClose}
        >
          {t(message, variables)}
        </Alert>
  ```

title: Support IPv6 in logger test or force IPv4 in boilerplate-express

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Issues that need priority attention. Platform, Curriculum tests (if broken completely), etc.

labels.name: scope: curriculum
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

labels.name: status: waiting triage
labels.description: This issue needs help from moderators and users to reproduce and confirm its validity and fix.

body:
### Describe the Issue

The issue is related to Node.js versions 17+ and running the "Basic Node and Express - Implement a Root-Level Request Logger" challenge on localhost. The IP in the logger regex test is expected to be an IPv4 address.

https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/40537

> Node.js now returns IP addresses in the order they are returned from the name resolver/DNS.



## Option 1

Change the regex in wrappers.js

https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/fcc-express-bground-pkg/blob/main/wrappers.js#L45

to support both IPv4 (as it does now)

```
GET /json - ::ffff:127.0.0.1
```

and the IPv6 localhost abbreviation

```
GET /json - ::1
```

I'm not sure how thorough a regex we should use. Does it need to cover all possible IPs?


## Option 2

Force IPv4 in server.js

https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/boilerplate-express/blob/main/server.js

```
const dns = require('dns');
dns.setDefaultResultOrder('ipv4first');
```

Tested and working.

### Affected Page

https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/back-end-development-and-apis/basic-node-and-express/implement-a-root-level-request-logger-middleware

### Your code

```

```


### Expected behavior

Logger test to pass on localhost with Node versions 17+

### Screenshots

_No response_

### System

- Device: [Laptop/Desktop]
- OS: [Windows 10]
- Browser: [Chrome]

### Additional context

https://forum.freecodecamp.org/t/basic-node-and-express-implement-a-root-level-request-logger-middleware/580132/3

title: Toggle buttons on Settings page are not accessible

labels.name: status: discussing
labels.description: Under discussion threads. Closed as stale after 60 days of inactivity.

labels.name: scope: a11y
labels.description: Threads for addressing accessibility issues.

labels.name: scope: UI
labels.description: Threads for addressing UX changes and improvements to user interface

body:
### Describe the Issue

I've been wanting to fix the toggle buttons on the Settings page for quite a while now. PR #48567 has already been started to implement a new ToggleButton component. I wanted to create this issue to make sure that any new components address all of the current accessibility issues. The current toggles have several issues:

- Their labels are not associated with their input
- They are not always keyboard accessible
- Some of them do not use the correct inputs for their functionality

There are two types of toggles on the Settings page:

- Toggles that invoke change immediately when the toggle value is changed (e.g. Night Mode, Campfire Mode).
- Toggles that only take effect when the corresponding Save button is clicked (e.g. the Privacy Settings).

These two toggles need to be created a little differently.

One option for the immediately invoked toggles is to use a group of two `button` elements, using the `aria-pressed` attribute to signal to screen readers which one is currently set. I have put together a codepen to demonstrate how this should be marked up and function.

[Accessible Toggle Group Using Buttons](https://codepen.io/bbsmooth/pen/PoBGVOZ)

Some of these types of toggles are of the On/Off variety and thus we could use an aria switch input for them if we wanted to introduce a third type of toggle. But I don't think this is a necessity, especially because one of these toggles is not On/Off. I think it would be better to be consistent across all of these toggles. So either use `button`s for them all or make them all On/Off toggles and use a switch.

The "delayed" toggles that can only be triggered with the Save button should be composed of a group of radio buttons. No special aria attributes need to be used here.

[Accessible Toggle Group Using Radio Button Inputs](https://codepen.io/bbsmooth/pen/KKBNmym)

A few questions:

- Do we want to create separate components for each type of toggle?
- The toggles should be wrapped in `fieldset`/`legend`s. Do we want to include that in these toggles?

### Affected Page

https://www.freecodecamp.org/settings

### Steps to Reproduce

N/A

### Expected behavior

See above write-up.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### System

N/A


### Additional context

_No response_
